title: ACCC gives green light to cold storage takeover
text:
The competition watchdog has given the greenlight to American refrigerated logistics giant Emergent Cold's takeover of local operator Oxford Cold Storage.

In August, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) raised "preliminary concerns" about the deal, which would create a company that controls 40 per cent of third-party cold storage services in Victoria amid an overseas takeover of Australia's $5 billion cold storage warehousing sector.

Overseas operators have a stranglehold on cold storage in Victoria. Pat Scala

After "closely considering further information received from the market and the two parties", ACCC commissioner Stephen Ridgeway said it was the regulator's view that the deal was "unlikely to substantially lessen competition".

“The ACCC ultimately found that, although there are some differences between how existing cold storage suppliers operate, the combined Emergent Cold-Oxford is still likely to face close competition in Victoria from a range of large and small alternative suppliers,” Mr Ridgeway said.

The ACCC noted in its decision that there were two other large suppliers of cold storage services in Victoria, NewCold and Americold, both of which are part of multinational cold storage businesses.
description: The ACCC said the takeover of Oxford Cold Storage by US refrigerated logistics giant Emergent Cold was unlikely to substantially lessen competition.
